#: Elliotte Harold changed the world a bit at a time by saying on  9/14/2005 11:12 PM :#
> Alexandru Popescu wrote:
> 
>> Still not sure what you mean. Can you be more specific what is the difference between JUnit support 
>> in Ant, Maven, Eclipse and TestNG support in Ant, Maven, etc? (I am not trying to start something, 
>> just want to understand your point better ;-) ).
> 
> JUnit is bundled with Ant and Eclipse. TestNG is not. It requires extra 
> installation. Ditto for many similar tools.
> 

Is it a big problem to install a plugin? Eclipse doesn't have for example a decent XML editor by 
itself, but if you would like to work with XML in Eclipse you will install one. This doesn't make 
imo Idea better/easier to work with only because it has XML directly supported.

But, let's stop here, as I understood your point. Thanks for clarifications.

cheers,
:alex |.::the_mindstorm::.|
